COMMAND.name: show net lan ipv4 setup
COMMAND.DETAIL:
This command shows the LAN configuration information. A description of all fields displayed is as follows:
<IP Address>: Static IP address of this device <IP Subnet Mask>: IPv4 Subnet Mask <Gateway IP Address>: IP address of the gateway. This is usually provided by the ISP or your network administrator. <DNS>: Domain Name Server (DNS) server IP address to covert the internet name (such as www.google.com) to an IP address.

COMMAND.name: show net lan ipv4 lan_clients
COMMAND.DETAIL:
This command shows the LAN clients information. A description of all fields displayed is as follows:
<IP Addr>: IP Address of the client connected. <Mac Address>: Mac Address of the client connected. <Type>: Type of the client connected whether it is Static or DHCP.

COMMAND.name: show net lan ipv6 setup
COMMAND.DETAIL:
This command shows the LAN configuration information. A description of all fields displayed is as follows:
<IP Address>: Static IPv6 address of this device <Prefix Length>: Prefix Length <Gateway IP Address>: IPv6 address of the gateway. This is usually provided by the ISP or your network administrator. <DNS>: Domain Name Server (DNS) server IPv6 address to convert the internet name (such as www.google.com) to an IPv6 address.

COMMAND.name: show net lan ipv6 Prefix
COMMAND.help: Show Prefix for Prefix Delegation Configuration.
COMMAND.DETAIL:
This command shows the Prefix for Prefix Delegation information. A description of all fields displayed is as follows:
<Prefix Address>: Configred Prefix Ipv6 address of this device <Prefix Length>: Prefix Length <Interface>: Name of Vlan Interface. <Vlan Ipv6 Status>: Status of IPv6 on vlan Interface.

CLISH_MODULE.COMMAND:
This command shows a cumulative total of the relevant traffic statistics for the interface specified by the argument <interface>. If the argument is not specified, this command will print statistics for all the interfaces in the system. A description of all fields displayed is as follows:
<Interface Name>: The stats are sorted by Ethernet port (eth0 vs. bdgWAN1) <Packets>: The number of transmitted/received packets over the relevant Ethernet port <Bytes>: The number of transmitted/received bytes of information <Errors>: The number of transmitted/received packet errors reported to the relevant Ethernet port <Dropped>: The number of transmitted/received packet drops in the relevant Ethernet port <Multicast>: The number of multicast packets sent over the relevant Ethernet port <Collisions>: The number of packet collisions reported to the relevant Ethernet port
<PARAM name="interface" help="Interface Name (eth0, bdg etc.)" default="all"
